title: Effects of Ceria Abrasive Particle Size Distribution below Wafer Surface on In-Wafer Uniformity during Chemical Mechanical Polishing Processing
zeta_potential: Type A slurry: –46.3 mV (0 % PAA), –55.6 mV (0.3 % PAA), –59.2 mV (0.5 % PAA)
equipment_model_calibration_details: 8 in. MIRRA polisher (AMAT Co.) with modified transparent glass sampling plate; SMPS, DMA, CPC (HCT Co.)

instrument_device_model.Polisher: MIRRA, AMAT Co. commercial 8 in. polishing machine
instrument_device_model.SMPS: HCT Co. scanning mobility particle sizer

pad_composition: IC1010 pad (Dow Chemical Co.); customized pad (20 µm pores, high pore density)
particle_size_distribution: Type A: 40–300 nm (peak 70 nm); Type B: 50–350 nm (peak 80 nm); Type C: 65–400 nm (peak 90 nm); Type D: bimodal (20–30 nm & ~100 nm)
particle_morphology: Agglomerated ceria nanoparticles observed by TEM; uni‑modal and bi‑modal distributions corresponding to slurry types
